column4: Is there any hope for running XGL/Compiz on a crappy, onboard video card?
Yes, as it doesn't require too much power
Really?
Any idea how old the mainboard is or how much RAM (shared probably) it uses (the GPU I mean)
The mobo's about 4 years old, 300-something MB or ram
That's overkill for XGL!
Really? Sweet!
You just need to turn on 3D acceleration (sorry, I only have experience with ati and nvidia)
That is the window manager not loading (run "metacity")
Are you sure? I thought I had metacity listed
Well metacity is the program which draws the titlebars
What about gdm?
GDM only handles the login and keeping the actual X session going. It is run by root for the system and has nothing to do with everyday user stuff
Hm, thanks. Maybe that's why :)
Ermmm... In /?
:-p Well, it isn't there. I'm installing an app and want to be sure

It is for "optional" stuff. Mainly Ubuntu uses /usr for packaged stuff and /usr/local for locally built source code. /opt isn't really used by Ubuntu (but I use it for Sancho GUI which I converted from RPM)
Maybe your preferences?
I don't believe so. It was doing it by default
Besides, it isn't per-application. Every video player plays all video files with washed-out colors and way too much brightness
Still, gconf-editor has a few settings for Totem, and MPlayer and VLC have loads of options
Yes, but it isn't any of my prefs. It's been doing it since a clean install.
